\# Simple Dictionary-Based Calculator

\#\# ![üìå][image1] Overview  
This project is a simple command-line calculator built using Python.    
It demonstrates the use of \*\*functions\*\*, \*\*dictionary-based function mapping\*\*, \*\*input handling\*\*, and \*\*basic error validation\*\*.    
Users can perform four basic arithmetic operations: Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, and Division.

\---

\#\# ![‚ú®][image2] Features  
\- Addition of two numbers    
\- Subtraction of two numbers    
\- Multiplication of two numbers    
\- Division with zero-division error handling    
\- Clean and modular code using function mapping    
\- Menu-driven user input system

\---

\#\# ![üõ†Ô∏è][image3] Technologies Used  
\- \*\*Python 3.x\*\*

\---

\#\# ![üìÇ][image4] Project Structure  
|-- calculator.py  
|-- README.md  
|-- statement.md



\---

\#\# ![‚ñ∂Ô∏è][image5] How to Run the Project

\#\#\# \*\*1. Clone the repository\*\*  
\`\`\`bash  
git clone \<your-repo-url\>  
cd \<your-repo-folder\>  
2\. Run the script  
bash  
Copy code  
python calculator.py  
![üß™][image6] Testing Instructions  
Run the program.
* Choose an arithmetic operation (1‚Äì4).  
* Enter two numeric inputs.  
* Verify whether:
   
1. Correct results are shown  
2. Division by zero returns: "Error\! Division by zero"  
3. Invalid menu choices terminate with a proper message
